author: lcallaghan74
title: Catalyst Common Idea Funnel
description: Wow this is overwhelming! Where do start? How do I find collaborators? Navigate platform? What ideas are already presented? How am I doing?

assessments.note: This idea offers support for project developers, through a project classification system, milestones and funnel for projects. One of the goals is to improve the feedback that project developers will receive as the number of proposals increases, by providing them with expert feedback in their project area. The problem posed is only described by a few very open questions and lacks concrete illustrations. It seems to me that experienced developers don't necessarily feel as lost in the Catalyst environment as the author suggests.

The Catalyst Common Idea Funnel is interesting and fits within the challenge, however, more information should be added to increase the score. Specifically, additional efforts could be made to link this proposal with the key metrics to measure within the challenge brief. The proposal could be expanded to explain how it can reduce the overwhelming burden that people face in order to get more external interest in Cardano. New proposers would still be faced with a deluge of information and without ongoing oversight, how would the system adapt or grow based on the level of interest/participation? The reliance on community is one potential way but it may also create further challenges since it's all volunteer leading to individual experiences being very different and inconsistent.
It is not clear this project meets the challenge. It seems more focused on proposers and entrprenuers.

Your proposal certainly outlines what you aim to do i.e. to provide a website that functions to channel potential developers and proposers into "spaces" with likeminded individuals. This no doubt addresses the challenge. I feel that your proposal could present more detail of the structure of the website and perhaps detail how this funnelling is implemented.

The catalyst common idea funnel sounds interesting to allow an easier access to catalyst but the challenge is called developer ecosystem. It could help proposals that then provide tools that create a positive developer experience. This is that is far fetched.

The developer ecosystem in Cardano is not likely to be improved by funneling or grouping developers into catalysts. The proposal overall explains the Catalyst workflow and has not connected how it is going to improve the developer ecosystem.

The author is responsible for the project alone and does not indicate having any development skills. He says he needs to recruit an IT developer to implement the project. The description of the project concept is fairly complete, but the technical implementation is imprecise. At this stage the risks of the project are not presented, and it seems that the author is not in a position to assess them without surrounding himself with the missing skills.

While the proposal clearly understands major challenges to entering the catalyst ecosystem, the skills and individuals required to complete this work is unclear. The proposer identifies they have 25 years of experience, but it is unclear to me whether "motivating thousands of people to find success, working in high level Hospitality Management/Marketing/Sales" is what is required to get this proposal to the next stages and implemented. 

While I appreciate the breakdown of each stage that a new proposer would go through, it is not clear the timeline or key performance indicators that would lead to successful implementation. 

The proposal would also benefit from adding in the process that would occur on the back end. Would there be opportunities to for more community input into the structure described here? What are the foreseen challenges and how would they be overcome?

How is this classification to be done. Manually? If automatically how are you setting it up? The plan needs more details on how this can automatically be done as a manual process will quickly become unmanageable.

I see that you have not provided a plan of how this website would be constructed or how you would roll out your vision. I am unsure whether your experience is entirely relevant to the task you outline. I think that by assembling a team around your proposal would greatly assist your chances of implementing this proposal successfully. Similarly, by breaking down your budget and describing how you would allocate the considerable sum of $60,000 would provide reassurance that the proposal had a strong direction and clear intent.

There are not many details about the qualifications of the proposer and there is not a single answer to the questions in the comments. The stages are described well, but that alone creates only little confidence towards a successful implementation.
The proposer claims experience in motivating people in sales and marketing. There is no reference to the type of tool that is proposed or experience in developer management.

No metrics are defined to assess the success of the project. The project leader does not list development milestones. It will be very difficult on this basis to assess the progress of the project. For a future proposal, I recommend including a development schedule, risk assessment, and a more explicit quantitative definition for project success.

Overall I like the idea behind the proposal, there is simply not enough information provided to allow a reviewer to assess the feasibility. 

The proposal identifies one of the major challenges for the entire Catalyst ecosystem and seems to be echoed by many newcomers, however, the proposal does not provide adequate details on how exactly it would reduce that. There is also a disconnect between the funnel process that is explained in detail and then the final request for funding to run prize competitions to get individuals into catalyst. It is unclear to me how these two are directly linked. If the funding requested here is for the prize competitions then that should be more prominent across the whole proposal, with better explanations of how the prize competition then leads to success of the funnel. 

I also cannot assess the feasibility given the budget as there is no breakdown. Why would $60,000 be needed for this? Would this cover the development too?
The plan needs more concrete detail to asses feasibility. The proposer should provide more information on how this proposal directly addresses the fund challenge as it is unclear.

I could not find any information in your proposal that provides sufficient information to assess how feasible it is and how effectively it addresses the challenge. If a plan of how you would measure success was present in your proposal I feel that voters would be more willing to commit to your project.

A very basic breakdown of the requested funds is provided. There are problem solving contents mentioned and also the salary for a developer. It seems that the proposer does not yet know, what exactly he will do with the funds. He has just a general idea. auditing such thing is extremely hard.
The proposal is abstract and the process to be followed for implementation is not clarified. It is difficult to audit the progress with the present state of clarity.

solution: This onboarding tool will establish member profile, orientation, Catalyst understanding and funnel common projects into working communities.
experience: I have spent the last 25 years motivating thousands of people to find success, working in high level Hospitality Management/Marketing/Sales.
